characters: CAT ON THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING
UNDER THE FLOOR FROM THE CAMERA'S POV
THE GUNMAN WITH THE GUN TO CAT'S HEAD
CAT EXITS THE STAIRS ON THE SIXTH FLOOR.
IT IS CAT, ALL GROWN UP.
AGAIN, THE CAMERA WATCHES HER AS IF THERE IS SOMEONE ELSE
ARE COMING UP. AND JUST WHEN THEY ARE ONE FLOOR APART,
A MOMENT LATER THE SWAT COME RUNNING BY WHERE SHE EXITED.
TRACK WITH THE KNIVES AND THEN...
PULL BACK TO THE TWO AMERICANS LOOKING AT EACH OTHER
HER EXPOSED CLEAVAGE. A MEDALLION ENGRAVED WITH THE
CAT SHOULDERING A LAWS SHOULDER ROCKET
UNTIL A RED BLINKING CIRCLE APPEARS ON THE MAP AROUND ONE
A SIMPLE FLOOR PLAN OF A HOUSE
A MAGAZINE PULLED FROM THE ENVELOPE
A PICTURE OF RIZZO BEING PINNED TO A WALL
A SEWER GRATE CUT INTO THE SIDE OF THE CURB
AS THE CAMERA WATCHES HER, IT FEELS LIKE SOMEONE ELSE IS
PULL BACK TO THE SWAT PASSING BY LOOKING EVERYWHERE.
WHERE A VERY FAMILIAR MEDALLION ON A CHAIN HANGS BETWEEN
MARCO DON LUIS AND THE THUGS
AND STILL, THERE IS THIS FEELING SOMEONE IS THERE, WATCHI
THERE. THIS BEGINS TO FEEL A LITTLE CREEPY. VERY TENSE.
A REAL CATALEYA ORCHID ON A COMPUTER SCREEN WITH THE WORD
AND THEN THE MESSAGE COMES UP
CATALEYA BEING TYPED IN THE SEARCH BAR
THE RED TRUCK COMES RAMMING THROUGH, TAKES OUT THE WHOLE
SPLASHING AROUND A SWIMMING POOL HAVING THE BEST TIME
TRACK CAT AS SHE SLIDES AT A FANTASTIC SPEED DOWN THE
THAT AT ANY MOMENT, SOMEONE IS GOING TO POUNCE.
THREE OF THE HOTTEST NYMPHETTES IN THE SMALLEST BIKINIS
SPLASHING WATER AT WILLIAM WOOGARD, AS HE CHASES AFTER
THE FACE OF A MIDDLE AGED AMERICAN
AND THE CONCEALED METAL PIPE CATCHES THEM ACROSS THEIR
A PHOTO OF CAT WITH HER PARENTS
WHEN IT SEEMS THAT THEY ARE GOING TO COLLIDE, RUN INTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATALEYA RESTREPO, CAT for short, a contained, very centered 10 year old, pretty, but with a toughness, sitti at the dining room table, in a well kept, but modest home with windows that look out over the steep hillside favela attends to her notebook. On the window there are half a dozen beautiful orchid plants. The rare Cataleya orchid. All around there are packed cartons, suitcases. Moving day is at hand.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Cat! Is your homework finished yet?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Working on it Mama. Her mother, taking time off from packing, comes over to Cat, and turns the page of the notebook to reveal the Lar Croft comic and it's copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You draw beautifully my love, but if you want to be something in life you have to study.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I am studying Mama. I want to be a super hero. Her mother turns the page back to the lessons.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Better to be a doctor. A lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Are we going to see Uncle Emilio? 2.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I don't know. Just waiting to hear from your father. Cat looks up at a picture on the wall of the family. Cat her mother, and her father. Her face carries a bit of worry.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I can't believe this. Mid 40'S, a gentleman, calm, courteous, impeccably dresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a table, with bottle of liquor and two glasses, Don Luis sits opposite...

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Why not? Cat's father. Off to the side, Don Luis's right hand man, MARCO, stands like any right hand, unobtrusive.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Because I love you Fabio. Like a brother.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: And I love you Don Luis. Like a brother. He turns to Marco.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Can you believe this guy Marco? We started when we were little...how old were we Fabio?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Ten year old bastards stealing apples from the carts in the market. After all we've been through. And now we're on top, he wants to leave...

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Luis, I'm going to be honest with you. You remember I had that operation? 3.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: That was last year.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Since then, I'm not a hundred percent. And you can't do this thing if you're not a hundred percent. I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: So you'll take a rest.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: You know how many times we should have been dead?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I don't even want to count.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Neither do I. But you gotta think. How lucky we are to still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's right. We're alive. And what about the future of this  thing we built?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: It's yours. It's not my thing any more.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I cabron?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: I'll always be there for you Luis. Just pick up the phone, I'm there.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I'm gonna hold you to that. You bastard. (EMOTIONAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: And I'm going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: OK. Enough of this sentimental bullshit. Next we'll be crying like two old women. Come on! One last drink, huh? He pours the liquor into the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: To the future. 4. They tap glasses.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Bueno. They shoot the liquor down. Fabio rises.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: So. Business is all clear?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: All clear. He hands Don Luis a computer disc.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: It's all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No other copies?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: You even have to ask?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Hey. He shrugs. Opens his arms. The two men embrace. Close as brothers.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Adios Marco. Make sure he doesn't get in too much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Adios Don Fabio. I'll do my best. And with that, Fabio exits the garden. Don Luis watches him, sad to see his friend go. Sighs deeply, pours himsel a whiskey, downs it, turns to Marco.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Kill this motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men, holding automatics in their laps sit in the back the driver in the front. They see Fabio very contained, calm, walking towards them. The driver turns the engine on. Fabio slips into the passenger seat. The car takes off. Fabio explodes. Smashes the dashboard. Over and over.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: This fucker! The motherfucker! He keeps banging the dash. 5.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Not OK Boss?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: This bastard thinks I'm an idiot. Playing it all mellow and shit. If he would have yelled and screamed and threatened to kill my whole family, it would have been OK. We  have an hour to get out of here. At most. Off the nervous looks of the guys in the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio's car comes to a screeching halt. Fabio exits to three other gunmen, nervous, on edge. The gunmen from the car take defensive positions. Fabio runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is still at the table drawing, when she hears the screeching of tires, the fast footsteps outside. She sens a storm coming. Fabio bursts in. His wife sees his tensio filled face.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Fabio?

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: We've got ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (PANICKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cataleya, go pack!

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I'm packed Mama. Cat is strangely calm, just sits at the table. Watches as Fabio takes the family picture off the wall, pries the frame back, extracts a small chip hidden inside the frame comes over to Cat.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Listen to me my darling. Just in case of anything. This... He holds the chip up.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: This is your passport. Do you understand? She nods. He places the chip in her hand, takes a card out of his pocket. 6.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: You find yourself alone? You go  to the address on this card. Show it to the man at the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I don't understand papa.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: You don't have to understand. You just have to listen, and remember. As Cat looks at the chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fabio's men keep a sharp lookout, two SUV's come rolli down the street. Their fingers work the triggers of their weapons. The two SUV's roll up. The blacked out windows roll down.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (polite. smiling) Hola. We want to see Don Fabio.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: He's not home.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You mind if we wait?

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: Your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabio writes on top of Cat's drawing, rips the page off folds it, puts it in her pocket, removes a medal from aro his neck, drapes it over hers.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: And this will keep you safe. Cat looks down at the medal.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEDAL
dialogues.text: An imprint of a flower.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: The Cataleya orchid. It comes from one place on Earth. Our place. My mother, your grandmother, used to grow them. Every morning I  would wake up to the sight of them. The smell of them. That's why I named you after them. It reminds us of who we are. 7. He kisses her on the forehead. His wife appears at the doorway with two suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the SUV is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: They said he's not home yet. He listens. OK. OK. He hangs up. Puts his phone back in his pocket. Walks up to Fabio's men.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Change of plans. He pulls out his gun, shoots them point blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they are exiting the house through a rear door, the shots ring out. They see another black SUV rushing up the street.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Back! He pushes his family back inside. Fabio runs to the windo Sees his men on the losing end of a gun battle. As the men fall, and others run up the stairs firing as they retreat toward the front door...

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Too late. Get ready! The Mother drops the suitcases and runs to the rear room. Fabio comes over to the unnaturally calm Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you very much.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I love you too Papa.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO'S HAND
dialogues.text: Reaches under the table where Cat is sitting, takes a gun strapped there. Next to the gun is a big knife. And then footsteps, coming fast outside, draw his attenti 8.

dialogues.speaker: FABIO
dialogues.text: Alicia! His wife runs into the room toting two big assed assault rifles. She tosses one to Fabio. Both of them take up shooter's positions facing the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Sitting at the table, very still. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: HER MOTHER AND FATHER
dialogues.text: Facing the front door, hands gripping their assault rifle sweat dripping down their faces, chests heaving, waiting, waiting, to blow anyone who comes through the door to kingdom come. But they never get the chance because...

dialogues.speaker: BBBBRRRRAAAAKKKKKK
dialogues.text: Machine gun fire shatters the windows on both sides of th room, tearing into their bodies before they even get one shot off. Tearing the orchid plants there to shred. Cat watches in mute disbelief, shocked, as her parents bodies are riddled with heavy caliber rounds making them twitch and dance like marionettes on wires. Their blood splattering across the room, across her. And then... Silence. Silence so complete it is deafening in it's absence of any sound. Cat just sits in her chair. And then the door bursts open and four gunmen storm into the room, their assault weapons trained on the only livin  thing in the room. Cat. Marco enters.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You in the kitchen. You, the bedroom. You, the back. The gunmen scatter. Marco has his inquisitive eye on Cat, who does not drop her eyes, impossible to read. One of the GUNMAN strides over to Cat, jams a gun to her head. Cat does not move a muscle. Does not blink.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Examines the frame Fabio dug the chip out of.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNMAN WITH THE GUN TO CAT'S HEAD
dialogues.text: He chambers a round, is about to pull the trigger... 9.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing? As the other gunmen begin to tear the house apart, lookin for something, Marco strides over to Cat. The frame in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Don Luis said kill everyone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: He also said no names.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: She won't remember. He is about to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: The gunman stops.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: She's a kid.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean so what? You take a kid, teach them, they have value. The gunman takes his gun, lifts Cat's lip, looks at her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: I couldn't even get ten bucks for her in the street. The gunman is about to pull the trigger again.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Are you stupid or what? Here. Marco hands him some cash.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Here's twenty asshole. Go do your job. Scowling, the gunman joins the others in ripping the hous apart, looking for something. Marco calmly goes to the fridge, takes out two bottles of water, cracks the caps, sets one down on front of Cat as he sits opposite her. Her hands are in her lap. 10.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember me Cataleya? Cat shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I was at your confirmation. My name is Marco, and I was a very good friend of your father. I see he gave you his medal. Alluding to the medal around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: The Cataleya orchid. His symbol. Your name. That's good. This way you will always remember him. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is a terrible thing for you to have seen.  All the while his men are searching, frisking the bodies of the dead, even tearing the heels off their shoes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Some things are too complicated for a kid to understand. This is one of them. But I am going to try explain it and make it very simple for you. So you understand. Now, you know who Don Luis is? Cat responds, shakes her head yes. Her hand slips imperceptibly under the table.

dialogues.speaker: HER HAND
dialogues.text: Touches the handle of the knife taped there.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Of course you do. He was your father's best friend since they're kids. He's like an Uncle to you. You know he has always been good to your family, don't you? Again Cat shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: This house, the food you eat, the clothes you wear. Even your school fees. All this comes from Don Luis. You know that? Again Cat shakes her head. 11.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: But when someone is good to you and you are not good to them back, then bad things happen. Things like... He alludes to the riddled bodies of her dead parents.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: This. Cat looks from the bodies and back to Marco, no emotion i her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I know you are a smart girl. You do well in school. So I know this is not too complicated for you to understand. Am I right? Cat nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Good. Now, your father had something that belonged to Don Luis. A little thing. No bigger than... He holds up his thumbnail.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: This. Maybe it was in this. He holds up the frame, shows where the chip was dug out o the wood.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Do you know what I am talking about? Cat nods.

dialogues.speaker: CAT'S HAND
dialogues.text: Gripping the knife handle.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Excellent. Do you know where it is? Cat nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Well, if you give it to me, Don Luis will be very grateful. And very generous. He will make sure that you are clothed, fed, and sent to the very best school. You will have everything you want. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MARCO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if you don't give it to him, he will be very unhappy. And you see what happens when he is not happy, yes?  Cat nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: So why don't you just give that little thing which belongs to him. Will you do that? Cat hesitates for a moment, and then removes one hand fro underneath the table, her fist closed tight. Marco smiles kindly. He holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You are a smart girl. Marco opens his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: And in this life, smart girls get everything they want. What do you want Cat? And just as she is about to open her hand...

dialogues.speaker: HER OTHER HAND
dialogues.text: Under the table, gripping the handle of the knife taped there.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Just tell me sweetheart...what do you want? In a flash, the knife is whipped out and buried into Marc unsuspecting, open palm. Driven with such force, the knif pierces through the back of his hand, and sticks into the table beneath; pinning his hand. Marco wants to scream but there is so much pain, nothing escapes his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: (in his ear) To kill Don Luis!

dialogues.speaker: AAARRRGGGHHHH
dialogues.text: The men searching look up, and before they can react, Cat races past them.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she runs through the rooms of the house, sprints to th bathroom where one foot hits the toilet, springing her onto the ledge of a very small window. As she looks back she sees the gunmen in hot pursuit. And she jumps, head first. Barely squeezing her small frame through the tiny window. And she drops... Six feet down, onto a ledge, that is just beneath the window. She flattens against the wall, holding onto the medal of her father.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: One of the gunman comes to the window, cannot fit through looks out, does not see anybody across, then hears someth beneath him, looks down, sees the tip of a shoe below. Puts his gun out the window, points it down, and....

dialogues.speaker: BBBBRRRRAAAAKKKKKKK
dialogues.text: Lets loose with a barrage from his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She watches as the bullets split the cement all around he feet. Coming inches from ripping into them. And then the barrage stops.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUNMAN
dialogues.text: His clip runs out. And as he fumbles to slam another one in...

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She hears the pause. Looks out over the sprawl of houses that stretch up and down the steep hillsides of the favel She looks down at her open palm at the small chip her fat gave her. Pops the chip in her mouth, swallows, leaps over the small divide between her house and the next roof and takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Gets the clip to fit, sees Cat heading off across the roo out in the open, exposed, vulnerable. He lifts his gun to shoot, when the gun muzzle is slammed up, peppers the ceiling with bullets. The gunman turns to Marco, holding  his bloody rag wrapped hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: We need her alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat leaps from one rooftop to another, shinnies down a drain pipe onto another roof. 14.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Jumping down from the window of Cat's home, start to spri across the roof in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She drops down to another roof, this one filled with a vegetable patch, where an old man is gardening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco exits Cat's house, wrapping his bloody hand tightly with a piece of his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Go! Go! He orders four more gunmen who have just zoomed up on motorcycles. The souped up rice rockets take off in four different directions.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: As she comes off the last rooftop, down into a small alle She sprints across to a small door. She kicks at the door which gives way and enters...

dialogues.speaker: AN OPEN COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Where a half dozen women are doing laundry by an open tap They look up to the sight of this little girl in the bloo splattered school uniform, do not say a word. And neither does Cat. She just runs through to a small gate on the far side of the courtyard, opens it, and disappears. One of the women casually hangs one of her wet sheets over th gate, hiding it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUNMEN
dialogues.text: They crash through the vegetable garden. The old man deft kicks a rake leaning against the wall. It falls in betwe the rows of tomato vines. When the gunmen sprint through, the first one trips over the rake, goes crashing through the vines, which causes the two men behind him to also trip and fall. The fourth man hurdles his fallen cohorts, bounds over the roof. And the fifth man, looks at the old man. Knows what he has done. Shoots him dead before jumping off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She races down a steep hill in the crowded favela streets
They enter the laundry yard. The women don't even look up. The gunmen look around, just see laundry hanging from the fence, do not see the hidden door. Race back out.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She runs down a steep alley, filled with people sitting outside their homes, chatting, playing dominoes. At the end of the alley, two motorcycles appear. The ride see Cat, as she sees them. They turn their bikes into the alley...

dialogues.speaker: VRROOOM
dialogues.text: And bear down on Cat. Cat sprints back up the hill. She goes to escape into one of the open doors, but she finds that one after another the doors have closed shut, the people fled inside. The bikes eat up the hill. Cat's legs are no match for them. It seems she will be caught any second. She ducks down a street where laundry is hung on a concealed metal pipe running the length of the alley. As Cat ducks throug the sheets the gunmen gun their bikes right towards her tear through the sheets...

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She looks back, to the dead gunmen, disappears over the  hill. AND JUST AS SHE DOES... Marco, in an open top jeep, with three of his gunmen ON BOARD, comes rolling up the road. He sees Cat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: There! The jeep screeches around. Cat dashes down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: As she runs up the alley with it's open sewers running on either side.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: The alley is too narrow for the jeep. The men spill out, spring up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Alive! 16.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She runs up the alley, then ducks down another one. She comes to a ladder that leads up a fence, begins to climb.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Running up the alley, turning into the next one. Where they see the ladder. One of the gunmen pulls out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: In the jeep, scouting as it rolls along.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She is running for all she is worth, out of breath, scare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More thugs on bikes, on foot, in cars. They are everywher

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She is leaning against a wall on a rooftop, gulping air  when she hears the roar of engines. Looks over the side of the building to see dozens of gunmen flooding the area

dialogues.speaker: ON GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Climbing the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: Hearing them coming.

dialogues.speaker: ON GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Surrounding a building. Throwing grappling hooks onto the roof ledge.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: Seeing the grappling hooks claw onto the roof edge.

dialogues.speaker: ON GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Cresting the roof from the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: ON GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Rappelling up the side of the building on the grappling ropes.

dialogues.speaker: ON GUNMEN
dialogues.text: Flooding onto the roof from both sides. Coming to the spot where Cat was only moments before. To find no Cat. 17. One of the gunmen takes out his cell. Dials.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: North! Go North! We're cutting off the southern streets! Marco slams his phone shut. Heads for his car.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: North!  The gunmen clear the roof. As the last one leaves, he takes one last suspicious sweep of the roof, cannot figur where this wisp of a girl went to. His eyes briefly focus on the chimney...

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: Let's go. He clambers over the side of the roof. THE CAMERA STAYS FOCUSED ON THE CHIMNEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, holding her breath, listening keenly to the sound of the men departing, is wedged into the chimney, her hands and feet clinging like a lizard to the walls on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes over the top of a hill, the soot of the chimney mingled with the blood of her parents, staining her dress The doors and windows all along the street are shuttered tight. Her eyes search the curb as she makes her way down the street. When she hears the sound of a vehicle. She looks up to a jeep turning the corner.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON MARCO
dialogues.text: In the windshield of the jeep, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: We got her! Close the net!

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She sees Marco. She pauses for a moment, and then does something that stuns even Marco. She starts to run right towards the jeep!
A bit stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: What is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She keeps sprinting toward the jeep. Another jeep appears  over the hill behind her. Starts to come at her.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: As his jeep speeds right for her.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: As she runs, her eyes go to the right, and it becomes apparent she knows exactly what she is doing. She has a plan. And she executes it. Suddenly, she leaps for the curb and... A SEWER GRATE.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: Sees Cat dive to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: As she wriggles her skinny little body down the grate, with barely enough room to squeeze in. But in she does squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARCO
dialogues.text: In total disbelief, watching her disappear down the narro slit in the curb. Both jeeps pull up. The men jump out. Marco flattens to the street, peers into the grate, sees Cat staring up at him. Marco takes his gun out. Jams it in the grate...

dialogues.speaker: BAMBAMBAMBAMBAM
dialogues.text: Empties his clip into the dark. When he runs out of ammo, he peers down again. Cat is gone. The gunmen run to the next sewer grate fire into that one. Marco looks down, no Cat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Get down there! The gunmen rip the grate out, jump down the hole. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen, following the beams of their flashlights, go tramping through the muck of the sewers, trying to find Cat. The only living things they find are rats, scurrying across their feet.

dialogues.speaker: GUNMAN
dialogues.text: (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost her!

dialogues.speaker: FUCK
dialogues.text: He kicks every car in the street in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunmen wait in the sewer, waiting. MARCO V.O. Come back out. The gunmen retreat back the way they came. They do not see someone watching them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small crevice in the sewer wall. Cat has squeezed herse into the crack, almost invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars and trucks rumble along a busy thoroughfare.

dialogues.speaker: A SEWER GRATE CUT INTO THE SIDE OF THE CURB
dialogues.text: A hand emerges. And then, Cat pulls herself out, into the street.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO CAT RISING
dialogues.text: She stands at the edge of the busy thoroughfare, and look around. She is in the heart of the city. Where tall offic buildings, compete with graceful, classical mansions. In the distance, she sees the hillsides, covered with the twinkling lights of the favelas, two miles, and a world away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Marines stand guard. Looking straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Excuse me... 20. The Marine looks down to Cat. Bedraggled, covered in soot and blood and shit. Holding out the card her father gave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American looks at the card Cat gave to the Marine, hands it to another American.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: And you say you have something for us? He turns to Cat, who nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: May I see it? Cat takes a beat. Puts her fingers down her throat. And throws up all over the man's desk.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: Oh jeez... Cat reaches into the goop on the desk and comes up with the chip. She hands it over to the man behind the desk, who takes a handkerchief out and takes it from her, gingerly. He looks at the chip, looks at Cat.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: (REPULSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: A COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Facts, figures, names, dates, a wealth of information scrolls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to record this. Cat does not understand. The second American hits a butto on a remote.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: My Papa. 21.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: And where is your Papa?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN 1
dialogues.text: Did he tell you what this is?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Yes...my passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat watches out the window as the plane's landing gear drops and the city of Miami spreads out before her in all it's shimmer and glistening glory.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: We are making our final approach to Miami International airport. Please fasten your seat belts. She looks down at the medal around her neck. A tear forms in her eye. Rolls down her cheek. Impossible to tell if it is a tear of joy or sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, with a plastic envelope holding her travel documents around her neck, accompanied by an airline rep, walks dow the jetway toward the entrance to the airport, where a MA is standing. Looking directly at her. All the passengers are filing to the left as they leave the jetway, but as Cat and her escort approach the man..

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Come with me. He walks to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands in front of a rotund bureaucrat, with the man who escorted her, handing over her passport.

dialogues.speaker: BUREAUCRAT
dialogues.text: She's the one?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: She is indeed. The Bureaucrat looks at her passport. As Cat glimpses through the slatted window looking out over the Customs floor, where all the other passengers are being processed in long lines. 22.

dialogues.speaker: BUREAUCRAT
dialogues.text: You must have done something pretty important to get the royal treatment little lady. Cat says nothing. He stamps her passport.

dialogues.speaker: BUREAUCRAT
dialogues.text: Welcome to America. Cat looks at him, not sure if this is good news or bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks out the window of the car at the skyline passin by, silent, filled with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You like music? Cat looks at him, doesn't respond. He turns the radio on. A god awful C&W song comes on. Cat looks at him for a moment, then reaches over, turns the radio off. Goes back to looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car passes a gate with a sign: MISS PORTERS SCHOOL FO GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: It's been our mission statement since we first opened our doors in nineteen twenty three...

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISSTRESS
dialogues.text: To provide a safe, healthy nurturing environment where young women can get the education they will need to meet the challenges of that amazing adventure called life. How does that sound to you, my dear? Cat does not respond, she just stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It's been a long day for her. Here's the check for the year's tuition. He hands over a check. 23.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: And the five hundred dollars allowance for the first six months. He hands over a wad of bills.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISSTRESS
dialogues.text: Which we keep right here... She places the money in an envelope with Cat's name on it and puts the envelope into a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISSTRESS
dialogues.text: And give you twenty a week for incidentals. She hands a twenty to Cat. Who takes it without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: HEADMISSTRESS
dialogues.text: What do we say darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three dozen girls of all ages go about their business. Some do homework on their beds, others do their hair, dan run around. And suddenly, at the sound of a door opening, they all stop and look in the same direction at Cat and the MONITO

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: Girls, this is your new classmate. Please welcome her and show her the ropes. (TO CAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up is at seven. Sweet dreams. She exits. All the girls stare at Cat. No one makes a move. In the silence, you can hear a pin drop, until... The biggest girl in the dorm, a head taller than everyone and twenty pounds heavier, with bully written all over he face, saunters down the aisle right towards Cat. Her name is...

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: I'm Sherri. And you are?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Very tired. The girls all around twitter. Sherri looks back at them, no good rising on her smirking face. 24.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Well, 'very tired', I'm sure you want to lay down and rest your little head? I do.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: There's your bed... She points halfway down the aisle to an empty bed. Cat is about to walk towards it, when Sherri puts a beefy hand i her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's gonna cost you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars. Cat looks at Sherri. Looks at the other girls all hanging on every word, waiting to see what jumps off. Cat considers, then reaches into her jumper and extracts the twenty dollars the headmisstress gave her. Hands it over to Sherri.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: A week. Peace has it's price, y'know what I'm saying? Cat says nothing, just stares at Sherri.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: Are we clear on that?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars a week. Sherri opens her sweatshirt to reveal a fanny pack. She unzips it, puts Cat's twenty in with a wad of other twenties.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: We got a smart one! The other girls hoot and whistle. Sherri removes her hand from Cat's chest.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRI
dialogues.text: You can go now. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In peace. Cat still says nothing. She walks up the aisle past all the other girls, who remain silent. It is only after Cat has laid down on her bed, that the laughing and twitterin resumes. 25. Cat stares at the ceiling, her hand reaches inside her jumper, takes out the medal her father gave her. She hold it close in her hand, just lays that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls are asleep in their beds. Silence reigns, except for the small cries and sighs of girls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Her eyes still open, her hand clutching her father's meda She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat makes her way down the hall. At the end of the Hall is a door marked EXIT. But she is not looking at the exit she is looking for something else. And she finds it. A door marked: HEADMISTRESS. Cat tries the door, it is locked. She takes her father's medal from around her neck, and uses it to pop the lock. Looking left and right to make sure the coast is clear, she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat tries the drawer where the Headmistress locked her money away. She looks around, takes a letter opener off the desk, pops the drawer, extracts the envelope with her name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Cat walks down the darkened hall, looking for anoth door. Finds it marked: INFIRMARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks along the cabinets containing the pharmaceutica until she finds what she is looking for. She smashes the glass door, reaches in, extracts one bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, with four belts slung over her shoulder, the bottle from the infirmary in one in one hand, a cloth in the oth stands over the sleeping Sherri. Cat pours the contents of the bottle out into the cloth. Seals the bottle. Puts it down. Then takes the cloth and  places it over Sherri's sleeping face, ever so gently. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun comes up over the horizon, casts it's first rays through the windows of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hits the faces of the girls. As they wake, they find two very interesting things. 1. A twenty dollar bill on each bed. 2. Sherri fast asleep, her hands and feet tied to the pos of the bed with belts, her shirt pulled up, her money bel gone. And the word THIEF written in magic marker across her stomach. And the drawing of the Cataleya orchid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kind faced Hispanic woman, a...

dialogues.speaker: TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: Hola chica, where are we wanting to go today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, barely up to the window, hands the ticket agent the piece of paper her father gave her. The woman looks at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: Chicago is not next door, you know.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: How much? Cat holds up the envelope from the headmistresses office.

dialogues.speaker: DAY/NIGHT
dialogues.text: The landscape of America passes by through the window of bus. Clutching a new Lara Croft comic, nibbling on a big Mac and fries out of a bag, Cat sees...  The sugar cane harvests in the Florida wetlands. Two big fat black women sitting on the porch of a shack shelling peas in the deep South. The Steel Mills of Pittsburgh fire up. The endless expanse of corn and wheat stretching from horizon to horizon across Ohio. 27. The giant milk barns of Indiana with their hundreds of cows. And finally, sees the great city of Chicago looming in th distance as the bus hurls down the highway towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As seedy as any bus terminal. People bustling, people hustling. A veritable cauldron of humanity bubbling with the good, the bad, the ugly. The predators and the prey. Cat exits into this stew of life, looks around, checks things out. As she is checked out in turn by some pretty sleazy types. Cat ignores the eyes following her, walks up to a dwarf hawking newspapers. Hands him her slip of paper. He point her in a direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks across the neighborhoods of Chicago. Sees the signs in Polish change into signs in Italian, in Spanish, Chinese, Ethiopian. She hands her paper to an Ethiopian cabbie. He points her onward. She walks past bars where black gangbangers watch her pas She hands one her paper, he points her on. She walks past massive churches, synagogues, mosques. She walks past the stately houses of the Gold Coast, alon the deserted stretches of the glam shops on Michigan Aven over the bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until she comes to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The denizens of this world look every bit as dangerous as they are. Gangbangers, con artists, trouble waiting to happen at every turn.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Cat, walking down the block as the eyes of everyone she passes follow her. She stops on a street corner. Seems lost. Opposite her a group of men, hanging outside a bar see her. The leader of the group calls her over.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hey kid. You know what time it is? Cat shakes her head. 28.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It's late, and this is not the kind of place a kid should be hanging out. What are you doing here? Cat hands him her paper. He looks at her, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Who are you? Cataleya. The man takes a moment...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Wait here. He disappears up a small alley into the darkness beyond. Cat, not knowing what to do, sits down on the curb, watch street life. She sees... Hookers soliciting men in passing cars. Cops sitting in a patrol car, bored, blase. Men playing craps against a wall. Some very discreet dope deals, more sleight of hand than anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very bloodied face. Once, twice, three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILIO RESTREPO, 35, a hard case, fuck with me at your ow risk written all over his face, is about to deliver anoth crushing blow to a poor soul strapped to a chair when...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Emilio. The beating stops, Emilio turns.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: There's a girl looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in a girl right now. He turns back to the task at hand. Cocks his fist. 29.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: It's not that sort of thing. She's eight. Again, Emilio stops. The man hands her Cat's paper.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Says her name's Cataleya. This focuses Emilio's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is sitting watching the street, when a pair of legs appear in front of her. Cat looks up to the man who disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Come with me. He turns abruptly, heads back up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat follows the man through a darkened alley. At interval on either side, dangerous looking men, armed to the teet stand in the shadows. The man opens a door, beckons Cat to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat follows the man as he moves down a long hallway. Cat looks into the rooms on either side of the hall as she walks along. In one room, opening out to a trucking bay, TV sets are being unloaded into a big warehouse full of stolen merchandise. In another room, guns are being serviced. Lots of guns, hand guns, assault rifles. Big artillery.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Cat's attention is drawn away from the room with the guns to the Man holding a door open for her at the very end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat enters an office with three women working on computer Looks like any other business office. At the sight of Cat, the women get up and exit, closing the door behind them. Cat is left alone. She looks around the office, when the sound of a door opening behind her. She turns to Emilio. Who approaches her cautiously, scrutinizing her. 30.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Cataleya? Now it is Cat who hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Uncle Emilio? Emilio covers his mouth, seems rocked.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Madonna! I thought you were dead! He crosses himself.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: I thought you were all... Cat stands stock still. Emilio takes her up in his arms lifts her, crushes her to his chest. Cat remains suspende emotionless for a moment. And then, for the first time emotion, real emotion, washes across her face. Her lower lip begins to tremble. Tears well up in her eyes. She bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: You're safe now. All the emotion, the fear, the anger that she has kept locked away deep inside, rushes to the surface in one massive wave.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: You're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun peeks over the horizon, spreading the fog infused light coming off Lake Michigan across the sleeping city a it ascends in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beam of sunlight slips through the narrow crack betwe a window and the shade covering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ray of sunlight washes across Cat's sleeping face. She wakes slowly. Her eyes open after a long sleep. For a moment she does not remember where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks around the clean, orderly bedroom as she gather her thoughts. Her eyes move around the room. It is a boy's room. 31. With models of soldiers, futuristic warriors, a big poste of Al Pacino as Tony Montana in SCARFACE. A poster with every imaginable type of assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio sits reading the financial section of the morning  paper over what seems to be the remains of a very hearty breakfast. An elderly woman, grandmotherly, fills his coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Gracias mama. A noise turns both of them to the doorway and Cat.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: Buenos diaz Cara. Come. Sit. I'll make you some eggs. Mama caresses her face, her eyes glisten with a grandmother's love. Kisses her on the forehead, lovingly whispers into her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: You have your mother's beautiful eyes. Don't be scared. This is your home. Slowly, hesitantly, Cat makes her way across the kitchen to the table, where she sits opposite Emilio, tentative.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: When was the last time you slept?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I don't know. A long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Well good. A growing body needs sleep. When I was your age I would sleep half the day. I don't know if it helped with the growing, but I was well rested for whatever came after.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Whose room is that?

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: My son. Your cousin.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Where is he? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. His voice holds anger, not sadness.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Killed?

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: No one who is still alive. Mama comes over, puts a plate of eggs in front of her. As she begins to wolf down the food. He holds up the page of her drawing, the one her Father put his address on.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: You are very talented. Is this what you want to be? An artist?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I used to want to be like Lara. A super agent. Shoveling more food into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Not anymore? Chewing, Cat shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: And now?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) I want to be a killer. She keeps shoveling food in her mouth. Emilio looks up at his mother, who crosses herself. Cat finishes the last mouthful, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Can you help? Emilio blinks once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio walks Cat down the street. He is carrying a kids book bag. 33.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: The good news is your father bought you your life with what he gave you. The bad news is Don Luis was playing both sides, and has disappeared. You tore down everything he spent years building up with that little chip. It is something he will not forget. There is a law in this thing of ours. If someone does you, the revenge goes all the way down the line. Women, children, Grandmothers, dogs, cats. No exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Are you trying to scare me?

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: I am trying to educate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRINCIPAL watches Emilio count the money out.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Normally we don't accept students in the middle of the academic year, but under the circumstances, losing her parents in that tragic car accident... Cat looks out the window, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Here. He hands a list over to Cat. Who keeps looking out the  window.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: These are the school supplies you'll need. Emilio takes them.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: She's still in a bit of shock.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Of course. See you Monday Cataleya. Such a pretty name. She keeps looking out the window. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emilio walks along, with Cataleya, reading the list of supplies.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: We'll get all this stuff, then go over to this little place I know down on Maxwell street for some of these hot dogs the Polish people make here. He turns left at the cross street...

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: You like hot dogs? He looks down, sees no Cat. Looks back to see Cat walking in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Hey! Cat keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Hey! He hurries, catches up with her.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I've already been to school. I told you what I want to be. You don't want to help me, fine. I'll do it myself. She walks off. Emilio grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Chica. Any idiot can be a killer. Look! Emilio draws a .357 magnum pistol from his shoulder holst and empties the entire clip into the front of a car comin down the street. The car careens off the road, smashes a fire hydrant, crashes through a plate glass window of a shop across the street. The water from the hydrant shoot twenty feet in the air. Emilio holsters his gun.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: You want me to teach you to be a killer? No problema. I'll teach you. But you'll be dead in five years. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you want to be a killer, and survive, you have to be a smart one. You have to know things besides how to pull a trigger. You have to know how the world works. How people think. You got to learn to be psychological. That I cannot teach you, unless you learn the basics at school. Got it? Cat glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Now what's it going to be? He holds out the gun in one hand, and the schoolbag in th other. Cat hesitates for a moment. Takes the schoolbag from Emilio. Then takes his hand, and they walk off together as police sirens announce the arrival of cruiser and people pour out of the school and the surrounding stores. As they put distance between the chaos and themselves.  But I still want to be a killer.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: (SIGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepy California town on the way to nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police cruiser sits on a quiet street, right off a wide avenue. Main street. There is no traffic either way. The nose of the cop car juts out just off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops are sitting, peeling back the wrappers on their burgers. coP 1 So then I suggest, y'know, we buy some things to spice it up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: COP 2
dialogues.text: Define things. 36. As they nibble and talk, they pay scant attention to a se of headlights coming up the broad avenue. coP 1 A garter belt, some of those stockings that come up the thigh...it's fourteen years. Know what I mean? The lights come closer...

dialogues.speaker: COP 2
dialogues.text: Yeah. No matter how much you like steak, sometime a lamb chop is not a bad thing. The lights shine right into the car.  coP 1 Exactly. Only then, when the lights are directly on them, do the cops turn to see a car heading right toward their front end. coP 1 What the...

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: The front end of the cop car gets sheared right off by th impact. Glass shatters, metal crunches, airbags explode!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other car. The drivers door opens. A vodka bottle falls out, clinks to the sidewalk. And a moment later, two legs emerge from the car. Two very long, very shapely legs. Legs that never end. In very high heels, and a very short mini skirt. And the face on top of it, framed by a mane of wild hair, is drop dead think-you-have-died- and-gone-to-heaven gorgeous. The whole package reads SUPERMODEL. And by the way she is weaving when she stands and the bottle at her feet, the read is; very drunk supermodel. Who looks at the crumpled police cruiser, looks into the windshield of the cruiser at the stunned cops, and says in the most sweetly drunk voice...

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMODEL
dialogues.text: Oops... The cops can't believe this. They regain their wits and bolt out of the car. coP 1 That's all you have to say? Oops? And, ever so sensually, she starts to laugh. The cops look at each other, perplexed. And she keeps laughing. 37. The cops get pissed. coP 1 Funny? ...and she keeps laughing. coP 1  Wanna laugh you crazy bitch? I'll give you something to laugh about! And even when they slam her to the hood of the car, jam her hands behind her back, and slap the cuffs on, she kee laughing, and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet night in the small station. Cat stands in front of the booking desk, so drunk the two cops have to hold her up. A surveillance camera over the desk innocuously records everything. Cat keeps her head down, her face, obscured by her mane of hair. As the SERGEANT goes through her purse, finds...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: No license, no registration. No ID except a library card. Well Ms... He reads off the library card.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Valarie Phillips in addition to all that...you're being charged here with DUI, destruction of police property, driving the wrong way on a two way street...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Unless you can think of anything else you should be charged with.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: (TIPSY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing no panties? 38. The Sergeant and the arresting cops holding her up give her a long look, as do any of the other cops in ear shot whose eyes go to her very short skirt.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: That's not a crime.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Thank goodness. And she teeters over, passes out cold right on the Sergeant's desk.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Take her in the back, lock her up, put a cup of coffee in with her. Let her sleep it off, we'll book her tomorrow. The two cops who booked her drag her out. As they do, the Sergeant and the two other cops on duty lean over to try and get a look up her very long legs and her very short skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three black SUV's, with blacked out windows, come rolling up to the station. The doors open and a dozen U.S. MARSHA jump out. Vigilant, forming a cordon around one of the vehicles, out of which comes a hand cuffed, kevlar wearin hard as nails MAFIA type. GENNARO RIZZO. The Marshal's surround him, guns bristling, on the look out for any danger, and hustle him towards the doors of the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station doors slam open. Marshal's barge in. The HEAD MARSHAL approaches the surprised Sergeant on the des flashes his credentials.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: US Marshal Warren. We have Gennaro Rizzo here on an overnight.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Rizzo. The Mafia guy? On the way to testify up in San Francisco tomorrow? They didn't notify you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. He rifles through some papers. Finds one. 39.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Here we go. Says here you're not expected until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Never expect the expected Sergeant. (to his men) Secure this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshals come down the cell block, checking everythin out. They pass Cat in her cell, passed out cold, her long legs and short skirt slows their progress a bit. After a long look, they move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo is pushed into a cell. The door is slammed and locked.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: One man here. Two more outside the front door. Everyone else on the perimeter, in teams of two. He hands out thermos bottles.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: It's a caffeine kinda night fellas. Eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone cop passes Cat's cell, doing the nightly rounds. As soon as he is gone...

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: Cat's eyes snap open. She sits up, moves with the efficiency and determination of someone who has not has a drop of alcohol. She takes a spoon from the coffee cup left for her, reaches into her mane of hair and extracts small pin. She inserts the pin into the keyhole of the door, jiggles it. The door pops open.  Cat exits the cell, takes a broom leaning in the corner and keeping her eye on the camera above the door, she sli along the wall, until she is just under the camera. She uses the broom handle to tilt the camera up just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One lone cop sits in front of the various monitors. He does not notice that one tilts slightly up, points toward a blank wall. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, under the camera, unlocks the second door, slips out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes into the hall where several vending machines lean against the wall. On the far side is a door marked: ELECTRICAL. She is about to head for it, when she hears a door open at the far end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: At the far end of the hall. A cop comes in, looks down the hall. Where Cat was standing he sees only the vending machines. He heads right for the machines. Puts coins in the machine, waits for his food.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDE OF THE MACHINE
dialogues.text: Where Cat is pressed hard against the flat surface, inche from the cop. The sandwich falls, the cop retrieves it, moves off, exit down the hall. Cat waits until she hears the door shut on the far end of the wall. She crosses quickly to the door across the way, enters.

dialogues.speaker: A UTILITY BOX PULLED OPEN
dialogues.text: Revealing the electrical control panel for the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands on a narrow shelf, undoes the last screws on a vent in the ceiling with a screwdriver from the tool boar on one wall. Cat drops down, opens the electrical control panel on th wall, studies it for a moment, finds the switch she is looking for, then turns to the wall of tools, plucks some wire, a cutter, a spring. Cat sets to work on a jury rigged mechanism with the item at hand. When she is finished, she tugs at the waist band of her mini skirt, and little by little she stretches a thin dun colored leotard suit over her whole body. She takes a small plastic vial, fills it with some water from the tap, and sets it, just so, above the device she has constructed. The device is hooked to the switch she selected, a small weight hangs from the bottom of it by a wire. She sets the water container just so over the spoon from her cell. The water begins to drip a drop at a time. She closes the panel door, sets her digital watch. Hoists herself up to the vent in the ceiling, and is gone. 41.

dialogues.speaker: THE JURY RIGGED DEVICE
dialogues.text: Water dripping into the spoon a drop at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once inside the grate, Cat takes one of the buttons off her blouse and presses the top of it. The button becomes a pin light, which she clasps between her teeth, starts t crawl on her stomach, pulling herself along by her elbows and her wriggling hips and knees, the light still between her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK WITH CAT
dialogues.text: As she moves through the maze of ducts. On the way, she peers through the grates in each ceiling, down into one cell after another, catching various views of inmates asl as she passes over them. Until she comes to a ventilation fan blocking the way. The fan blades go round and round. Cat looks at her watch, looks at the fan.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELECTRICAL PANEL
dialogues.text: And Cat's jury rigged device. The water has almost filled the spoon, one more drop, one more drop.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LOOKING AT HER WATCH
dialogues.text: The digital counter goes from 4 to 3 to 2 tol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last drop of water drips into the spoon, the spoon tips, tugging on the wire, the wire trips the switch it i connected to, the whole device comes apart, the separate pieces fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fan stops. The blades slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sergeant at the desk hears the ventilation system go off.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Hey Doyle! He calls to one of the other cops on duty.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Go take a look at the breaker on the ventilation system, will ya? Doyle moves off. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat watches the blades of the vent fan slow. When they have completely stopped she starts to move herself throug the very narrow space between the now stilled blades, fee first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle enters the room, opens the electrical panel. The spoon, the weight, the spring, and the wire, fall to the floor. Doyle looks at them curiously for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is half way through the fan blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle looks at the switches, going down the printed list on the door, trying to locate the right one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is almost through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle finds the switch that corresponds to the ventilatio system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's neck passes through the fan blades. Slow going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle hits the switch for the ventilation system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is just through, when the blades start moving, brush against her forehead, as she makes it to the other side with no time, and no room to spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to a vent, looks down, begins to loosen the ven screws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat drops down into a bathroom. Looks at her watch. Sits down, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo is asleep in his cell. The Marshal on duty finishes his coffee. Looks at Rizzo. 43. Then walks over to the door at the end of the wall. He hits a buzzer on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop manning the bank of monitors, wakes up, sees the Marshal in the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: (OVER INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta pee. The monitor hits a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door buzzes open. The Marshal passes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal pushes the bathroom door open. Enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal finishes peeing, zips himself up. Turns. Right into a devastating reverse wheel kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop on duty hears a buzz, looks up to the bank of monitors, and sees the Marshal standing at the door. Thinking nothing of it, he hits the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, propping the unconscious Marshal up, hides behind him. As the door buzzes, she maneuvers the body around, pushes through. On the other side, she drops the body, and takes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor it looks like the Marshal is passing throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rizzo is half asleep, when the barrel of a gun taps him o the head. He opens his eyes slowly to...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Unbutton your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Now. 44. Rizzo looks over to where the Marshal is passed out cold on the floor. He does as he is told.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Not room service. She pumps four bullets into his head.

dialogues.speaker: BAMBAMBAMBAM
dialogues.text: The four shots reverberate throughout the station.

dialogues.speaker: BAMBAMBAMBAM
dialogues.text: Two patrols of two Marshal's each hear the shots.

dialogues.speaker: BAMBAMBAMBAM
dialogues.text: The monitor wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops and Marshal's, guns drawn, come running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knocked out Marshal comes to. Finds a gun in his hand Doesn't get it, until he looks over to see Rizzo, with hi face blown off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open and the Marshal's and cops come pouri through, to find the Marshal with the gun in his hand and the dead Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: Drop it!! The Marshal is frozen, totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Drop it, Joe!!!!! More guns. More confusion. Tension beyond the moon.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: I didn't do it! 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!!!! The Marshal drops his gun.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: On the floor!

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Call a bus! FROM THE POV OF SOMEONE ELSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: through the vent over the cell. Sees the wobbly confused Marshal with the gun in his hand, hears feet com Cat looks fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes She looks stationed Cat takes

dialogues.speaker: OF POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: climbing out of a ventilation duct onto the roof. out over the side of the building. Marshal's outside are running into the building. off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are cuffing the Marshal.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Guys! I didn't do it!!!

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL 1
dialogues.text: Ambulance on the way! Another Marshal is checking Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Search the place!

dialogues.speaker: OF POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: Cat is running as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops and Marshals are running through every room, checkin  everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches another air vent, so about to pry it off when she hears... 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops running up the stairs, headed for a door above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hears the door begin to open. She bangs her high heel together. And two blades come out of the front. She sees the door knob turning. She runs for the roof's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops burst through the door to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops pour onto the roof, looking around, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: CAT ON THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: Clinging to the wall like a gekko. The dun colored wall blending with her dun colored suit. How is she doing this

dialogues.speaker: CAT'S SHOES
dialogues.text: The blades fitted into the seam between the bricks. Her fingertips clinging to the small lip on the bottom of the roof's edge.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE HER
dialogues.text: The cops look around the roof.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAT
dialogues.text: She holds there listening to the noise above. Hears noise below, looks down to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops searching the alley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging to the edge of the building. Listening, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops, finding nothing, head back out the door. A mome later...

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF LEDGE
dialogues.text: Cat's hand reaches up.

When one hand has a firm grasp on the roof ledge, she let go with the other hand and grasps the ledge, extracts the blades from the brick seams, and swings herself up on the roof. As her shoes dislodge, some mortar comes loose and falls below.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COPS BELOW
dialogues.text: The crumbling mortar falls on the head of one cop, he loo down, sees the crumbly gravel, looks up, sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat lands on the roof, lays still.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COP BELOW
dialogues.text: He examines the gravel, looks up again. And then moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat pries the vent cover off, slips in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops are checking every cell in the men's block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is crawling along as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops come to the entrance of the woman's cell block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to the vent in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops open the door to the women's cell block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat runs. Begins to pull at her leotard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops look at the women's cells, heading right toward Cat's. As they reach Cat's, the same cop who did the roun at the beginning of the night looks into her cell. Cat is laying on her side, away from them, dead asleep, in the same position she was when the cop first checked on her. The cops pause for a moment, then move on.
Her eyes are wide open. She listens for the outer door closing, and then she breathes out, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance pulls up, along with the Marshal contingent in their SUV's. The Marshal's spill out of the SUV's as a gurney with a corpse is wheeled into the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Marshal's stand around, the Police Coroner begins to unbutton the shirt of Rizzo the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Rizzo's chest the word TRAITOR is written in thick bla letters. And above them, a drawing of the Cataleya orchid The Marshal's knows what this is.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Call Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of a small jet opens and MARCUS ROSS, 48, a kee eyed, no nonsense all business FBI agent, followed by a team of similarly focused men and women, exits down the stairs to...

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: Agent Ross?

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: At the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters are gathered, trying to gain access. The police are keeping them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the clamor of reporters outside, Cat is just finishi with her finger printing, wipes off as much of the ink as she can. The Sergeant hands over her library card.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I shouldn't drink. 49.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: No you shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I'm so so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Tell it to the judge at your hearing in ten days.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: What's going on out there? Alluding to all the commotion she sees through the window looking out into the main room.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Nothing. Fill out the forms and you can go.  Really?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Really. We need to get things organized. But don't worry, the judge will send you back, for sure.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I probably deserve it. He hands her a sheaf of papers and a pen. As the pen hits the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross, with his team standing off his shoulder, looks down at the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Same handwriting. Same flower. It's him. Let's see the location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hands the paper work over to the sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: You're lucky no one was hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I would have never forgiven myself. Keeping her back to the security camera overhead, Cat collects her things and exits. As the door closes... 50. A DOOR TO AN SUV OPENS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross exits the SUV to the crowd of reporters.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Is it Rizzo? Was it an assassination? Are there any clues? Is it true a Marshal did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment. Ross sees cops coming and going from the station. He turn to the Marshal with him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: You didn't lock it down?

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: It was after the fact. I didn't think... Ross cannot believe what he is hearing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Do it. Now. No one in or out.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Exiting the station. Ross and his team sweep past her.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHAL
dialogues.text: OK! That's it. No one in or out! Lock down! Cat just keeps walking, right past Ross, who heads into the station as the cops try to keep the reporters at bay.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Walking away from the pandemonium she is leaving behind. As it recedes over her shoulder, she picks at her fingers where the fingerprinting ink has stained them. Her prints come off! She drops the fake prints down a sewer and keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross scrutinizes Rizzo's cell as his team takes prints, photos, sweeps the cell for evidence.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: I want to see paper on everyone in and out of the station in the last twenty four hours. He looks up to the end of the hall. 51.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: And I want the tapes from the  security cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat extracts a knapsack from the locker, heads for the woman's bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat tugs at her hair. The wild mane comes off to reveal her straight hair, which she pulls back in a pony tail. She begins to strip out of her mini skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat dressed in jeans, a scuffed leather jacket, a basebal cap, with the brim pulled low over her eyes, with her pon tail sticking out of the back, the knap sack on her shoulder, waits on line to board the bus. She keeps her back to the security camera, has her phone to her ear. A number is ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio, fifteen years older, is watching a soccer game, picks up the phone. In the kitchen, Mama is cooking.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Are we good?

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN THE TWO
dialogues.text: Cat moves up the line to board the bus.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: We're good.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: When are you back?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Day after.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: I have something.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: The morning after OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't wait to see you Cara. 52.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Say hello to Mama. He looks over to Mama at the stove, who waves over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Mama says hello back. He hangs up, goes back to his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat boards the bus. The doors close behind her. As the camera ZOOMS up, and the bus pulls out onto the road... ROSS V.O. See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is pointing up at the camera Cat tilted.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: He tilted the camera just enough so the angle would catch the guard, not who was holding him. He turns to his team.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Twenty two murders in four years all with the same M.O. The word, the flower. He's sending a message, for sure. And I'm beginning to think it's not to us.
