dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: But we're the only ones with the information.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: And we're not getting anywhere with it, are we? No one on the team can dispute this. It occurs to Ross..

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: If the message is not for us, let's make sure the one it's intended for gets it. I want you to put it out to the press. Splash it across every newspaper, every magazine. National. I want eyeballs on it coast to coast. Monitor it. Let's see if anything comes back. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lincoln town car comes down the leafy, quiet street of well kept homes. Stops at a gate guarded by two men, who wave him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car ends up in front of a very impressive house, whic sits at the end of a long driveway. Toward the era of the walled property, a garage, and a guest house. MR. RICHARD in a suit and tie, looking like a proper mid level government official, or a lawyer, exits, newspaper in han As he approaches the front door, Richard looks over to se two more guards, off to the side. He nods to them, knows them. They nod back. Richard approaches the front door, knocks. While he is waiting, he looks down at the paper. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Mr. Richard... Richard looks up to a fifteen year older Marco.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes it has Marco. How's the hand? Marco holds up his scarred hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Only hurts when it's humid.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Should've let us relocate you to Arizona instead of New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: The Boss likes it humid.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: There it is then.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: He's waiting for you. Richard enters. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis stares out a bay window, drink in hand.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hello Luis. 54. Don Luis turns.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Hello Mr. Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I brought you the morning paper. He holds the paper up. CLOSE ON A PICTURE OF DEAD RIZZO ON THE FRONT PAGE.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Coincidence? Twenty two times? A flower that only grows in one place on earth? That used to be the calling card of...what was his name? Your former partner? The one who did your wet work?

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Fabio. Fabio Maria Restrepo. But I don't understand? Why come here with this?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Because when we find the end of a string we like to know where it begins.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: String? Now we are talking about string? I'm not a tailor.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Don Luis. Let's cut to the chase here, OK? When the Agency extracted your ass from Colombia fifteen years ago, and set you up here, we let you resume your business when what we should have done was lock you up for life. In exchange, you were supposed to keep the information flowing.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: And I have. 55.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Not much, and not for a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: And this is what you traveled all the way down here to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No. What I traveled all the way down here to tell you, is there's a limit to our patience. The CIA is not an amusement park. There are no free rides. Everyone pays their way. And you, my friend, have not.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: OK OK. What would you want? He slaps the newspaper down with the picture of Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I had nothing to do with this. I  swear.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD

Along one wall, a cabinet. On the window sill a single Cataleya orchid. Cat waters the orchid. Cat opens the cabinet to three computer screens. Two of them are divided into quarters and show various views of the building entrance, the lobby, the stairway, the elevator, the hallway. The third screen is dark, until Cat hits a button and mus fills the apartment. Music with a heavy sensual back beat French Rap. Ooh la la. And the screen pulses and glows in time to the beat. Cat's body responds to the music, moving sexy, her shoulders rolling, her hips swaying.

But with this last killing... He holds up a stack of folders from his desk. 58.

One of them is our target. I want each of you to locate the ten people in the folder you've been given. I want a complete dossier on every one of them for the last ten years of their lives. Run down every lead. Check out every story. Our killer is out there. And we're going to find him. Before he kills again. THE CITY OF CHICAGO. As an elevator train rumbles by below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: (SMILES)

dialogues.text: ...Yes. She gently lowers his hands to his sides, holds them ther Kisses him deeply. Pushes him down onto the floor. And lowers herself on top of him. A small moan escapes his lips as she takes him inside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emilio walks down the stairs, carrying a shopping bag.  TRACK WITH HIM ALONG THE STREET. Until he comes to a Laundromat.

dialogues.text: The cover features WILLIAM WOOGARD, 45, the most unassumi baldheaded, pudgy faced man, a nerd. Under the headline: PREDATOR.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: (BLUFFING)

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: The paper says twenty two. All like this. Tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: No reason.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Since you're a kid, you don't do anything for no reason. Don't play dumb, it insults me.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I've got to get ready. As she goes to rise, Emilio grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: It's not just you in this. It's me, Mama. 63.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Tio. You're removed. You book the work, you collect the fees...

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: I watch your ass. Each and every job, I vet, I double vet. For every one I book you, I turn down five, ten. I promised to keep you safe. I KEEP YOU SAFE. Cataleya. It's a full time job, no matter what you think. Those pictures...they freaked me out. OK? I didn't realize...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I come to you at nine. I say I  want to be a killer. What kind of kid makes a career choice like that unless they have something on their mind. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live for the day that the blood of the son of bitch who did my parents drips in the gutter. Stop playing the innocent with me. You know this. Forever.

dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EMILIO
dialogues.text: Because I love you. Cat smiles. A smile that could melt ice in winter. But a knowing smile. A 'Don't bullshit a bullshitter' smile.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... OVER THE SOUND OF CHIMES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ramshackle warehouse, it's windows streaked opaque with years of dust and grime, surrounded by a fence, and a wee garden which is home to dozens of the most unique wind chimes of all sizes and shapes, made from scrap metal. And two of the biggest, most ferocious dogs on Earth, lay on their sides, asleep. The dog's ears perk up; hearing something we don't, a low growl begins to rumble deep in their throats. The gate to the garden begins to open, and like a shot the dogs are up, hurling themselves toward the opening gate, eyes flashing, barking loud enough to scare the dead back to life, fangs bared, ready to kill. And then they stop cold when they see who it is coming into their domain.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON CAT
dialogues.text: Holding two very full shopping bags.

dialogues.speaker: CAT

dialogues.speaker: CAT

dialogues.speaker: CAT

In the corner is one fully built truck, a big red  monster with huge demolition fenders. dialogues.text: The sharks gliding back and forth. And then, a figure in a black wet suit, fins and a mask, with a small back back comes gliding into through the sharks. He rises, dressed in a silk sleeping robe. He feels something on his chest, goes over to the mirror, opens his gown and sees, painted on his chest: In red lipstick, the word THIEF, and a drawing of a Cataleya orchid. Panic starts to set in.

dialogues.speaker: ARRRGGGHHHH

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Mr. Steven Richard?

dialogues.text: Hiding his anger.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I just wanted to be... On her surveillance screens, Cat sees FBI SWAT pulling up to the building.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Closer. I know. Goodbye Danny. Cat hangs up, rushes into the bathroom, turns the shower on full blast. Hurrying out, on her screens, she sees the SWAT swarming into the building. Cat opens a cabinet. On the back of the door are a dozen keys. She chooses one. She checks the screens one more time, sees the SWAT rushi the stairs, the elevators. She turns off her screens. And runs out of the apartment in her t-shirt and panties. Barefoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT are running up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT led by Ross are watching the elevator numbers climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches the stairs just as the elevator is reaching her floor. She ducks down the stairs as the elevator door opens, and Ross and his team step out, guns raised, exercising extreme caution, keeping very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat takes the stairs two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT comes running up the stairs, two at a time. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swat 1 listens at Cat's door. Ross is at the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT 1
dialogues.text: (whispers, on mic) Shower. Ross signals for a scope. SWAT 2 takes a flex cam, and begins to slide it under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat comes to a door, uses her key to open it. She enters to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a guy eating his lunch in front of the TV.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Hey! He reaches out to grab her. Cat grabs his hand and slams his face into his tray of food, knocking him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross watches the screen as the flex cam shows the interio of Cat's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat pulls down a camouflaged hinged door in the ceiling. On it, is a harness, with several things attached, guns charges, thick metal clips. She slips into the harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross's team goes from apartment to apartment. Knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the video cam, Ross is seeing nothing in Cat's apartme He points to one of the SWAT, signals for him to set char against the door. The man begins to do so. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is setting charges in a rectangular pattern on the rear bathtub wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents at an apartment door...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: No ma'am everything is under control. We just need you to stay inside. May we have a look around? As the FBI enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has finished setting her charges. She looks up at the ceiling, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross's man has finished setting the charges. He looks at Ross. The rest of the team fingers their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat waits, looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An FBI agent knocks on the door of the apartment she has just entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross give the go ahead nod. The SWAT hits his detonator. At the same moment that his charges explode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hits hers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's door blows open, the SWAT flood in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect rectangle is blown in the wall, revealing utili pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross and his crew swarm all over the place. Find the shower, empty. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has attached the hooks from the harness to the pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross barks into his walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: She's not here. Lock the building down !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat lets go. And drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is looking at the bank of security monitors in Cat's cabinet, sees all his men, all over the place, inside the building, outside.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Where the hell did she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat lands on the floor, next to door. She unhooks herself from the pipes, and pushes out the door. Enters through to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat looks around, listens, and then begins to make her wa across the garage, using the parked cars as cover from th security cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross leads his men as they scour the building.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: No one in or out! Lock this place down! Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: Nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2
dialogues.text: Nothing here. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches an open space where cars just cannot shield her. There are two security cameras covering it. Cat draws one of her silencers and shoots the lens out of one camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agent is standing next to the building security guard, when one camera goes out. ROSS V.O. Anything?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: Nothing...wait...one security camera down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat shoots the second camera. Heads across the open space quickly.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: The second one is down.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: The garage!

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) All units! Converge on the garage. Cover every exit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat has reaches a vent, which she removes, having loosene the screws before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT and Ross's team flood the garage. Vehicles screeching in, men running in full body armor, guns ready

dialogues.speaker: THE VENT GRATE
dialogues.text: Cat is just climbing into the space behind it.  PULL BACK TO The SWAT ALL OVER THE PLACE 97.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: (FRUSTRATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look under every car. In every trunk!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hurries along a tunnel, comes to a utility door, and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat enters a room full of lockers. She starts opening them until she finds what she is looking for. A maintenan uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks along in coveralls, boots and a hard hat, passi several crews of workers welding, hammering, doing repair She disappears into the gloaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A normal day. Kids playing ball. Trashmen picking up trash.

dialogues.speaker: THE REAR OF EMILIO'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Cat enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat walks through the house like it could be a trap, a silencer in her hand. Her senses are keening, she is that alert. And then she finds the first body. Mama. Dead. A bullet in her head. Cat has all she can do to keep it together. Then she find Pepe, a bullet in his head. It is almost too much for her to bear.  And then she finds Emilio, tied to a chair, tortured. To death. This IS too much for her to bear. Cat cuts Emilio's beaten and bloodied body loose, and gen takes HIM in her arms. And begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...I'm sorry...I'm sorry 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An operator answers.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation. How may I direct your call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat is on a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I'd like to speak to the agent in charge of the TAG killings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is pinning up the pictures of Cat on his board. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Agent Ross. Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is emptying out. In the lobby, Ross passes a floor cleaner and a lone security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross picks up a prepackaged meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross enters his building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross enters, turns on the lights, revealing an apartment as austere as Cat's. Heads for the small kitchen, where he is about to put his precooked meal in the microwave. When he feels a gun in the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: This won't take long. Hands up. Ross raises his hands. Cat reaches around, removes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Turn around. Ross faces her. 99.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Sit. She motions him into the chair behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Just so you know, all this? Being so smart? Covering all your bases? It's not going to matter. It's already over. The whole place is wired with web cams. His moment of triumph is short lived. Cat reaches on the side of the counter. Holds up six web cams, wires ripped out.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You mean these? Tosses the ripped out cams onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Talking about covering all your bases. Your chair is pressure wired. You move your ass one inch you don't have one anymore. Ross looks under the chair. Sure enough, there are severa wires leading out of the bottom of the chair. He looks further to the where the wires attach to a small charge. She puts her gun down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking. Maybe  yes a bluff, maybe no. But you have to figure yes, given what you know about me. Ross does not move.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: This wasn't what I had in mind for myself when I was a kid. I wanted to be on the other side of things. Like you.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: He did. She takes out an old picture of Don Luis, lifted from the internet. She takes out the picture of her parents and her as an eight year old.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: This is the last time I was happy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The next day they were dead. He killed them.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: And all this? All these clues...they weren't for us. They were for him.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I didn't know how else to find him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: And you figured sooner or later we would make this public.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: It took you a long time.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: You're very patient.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: What else do I have to be? I have  no one. I did. Until this morning. I had them. She takes out pictures of dead Mama, dead Emilio, dead Pepe.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: You sent him a message. He sent you one back.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: And now I want to finish it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: I can't help you.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Yes you can. He's protected by your government.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: By a part of the government I have no way of reaching. It's CIA. I don't know why. But there's no getting through it, under it, around it, believe me, I've tried.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You're going to have to try harder. She takes a photo album out, opens it. 101.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I found this on your table inside. Your family, right? Begins to flip pages.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Brothers, sisters, nieces, nephews. Mother, father. Nice. Ross knows what is coming.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I know this sounds harsh. But until I get what I want, you'll go to a funeral a week. And you will begin to feel what I have felt all these years.  She places the photo album in his lap. Puts his food in the microwave, starts it. Goes to exit.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Wait... She stops.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: What about...? He points to the chair.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: When your dinner's ready, the timer on it will have expired. Then you can get to work. And she is gone. Ross watches the timer on the microwave. When it beeps, he sits a moment longer. Hesitates to get up. Little by little, he moves himself off the chair, tentative. Afraid that any moment, BOOM! Until he makes the final move, stands just enough to clear the seat waiting for the worst to happen. And when it doesn't, he breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A non descript building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing a large picture window...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You understand, I only agreed to this meeting out of professional courtesy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The President wanting us to reach out to you folks on the domestic side, and all that pie in the sky crap. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, I really can't help you at all.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Can't or won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing really.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Look, let's put all our cards on the table here. I've met this woman. The killer.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (SKEPTICAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Where?

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: My apartment. She trapped me. She told me if I did not get her this man. He puts Luis's picture on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: She will kill a member of my family every day until I have none. Richard pauses. Then he begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You're kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Do I look like I could make something like that up? Richard says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: So? What should I do now?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I'd go to the police. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a meeting... He goes to rise, when Ross's phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Ross. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her. 103. Richard sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says you either give her what she wants or she is going to redecorate your office. Ross points to Richard's chest where a red laser beam hol on his heart.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Bright red.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What does she think this is? Amateur hour? Tell her that glass is tempered to resist a direct hit by a fifty seven millimeter ordinance. All of the sudden, a bullet shatters the window; destroyi a picture of Richard standing with the President hanging on the wall just behind his head. The red dot is back on Richard in a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: She says she's using seven point six two steel jacketed armor piercing shells. And you have ten seconds to give her the address. Richard starts to come unglued.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How can I be sure once she has the address she won't kill me anyway?

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: You can't. But I can assure you that if you don't give her the address you will be number twenty four on her hit parade. Trust me on this one. After an interminable moment...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Eight seven six Magnolia Terrace... New Orleans. There is a long pause on the other end of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: She asked you to keep this  conversation strictly confidential.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (SWEATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With pleasure. 104. A moment later, the red dot disappears from Richard's che Richard breathes out. Ross reaches out, shakes richard's limp hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Thank you. Because honestly I didn't know how I was going to explain you splattered all over your walls. Ross exits. Richard looks at the shattered picture. The President's head is intact. The bullet has ripped Richard face clean off. CLOSE ON A BIG STEEL DOOR OPENING REVEALING An ARMORY OF WEAPONS FROM PISTOLS TO RPG's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat loads weapons and ammo into Pepe's big red truck. The last thing she takes: a LAWS rocket launcher. The dogs sit there, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You guys ever been to New Orleans? Off the dog's puzzled faces...

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: The red truck smashes through the doors of Pepe's warehou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck heads off down the road, disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat drives through the night, just watching the road. The dogs sit behind her, also watching the road. She passes a  sign: NEW ORLEANS 500 MILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMITH, a courtly old architect, opens his door and enters his building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith enters to find...

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Good morning. 105. Sitting, with two cups of coffee, and pastries.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I didn't know if you took sugar and cream, so I got one of each.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: You designed the house at eight seven six Magnolia.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You either leave immediately young lady or I am going to call the police. Cat pulls a gun.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I would love to see the plans of this house.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You will take up positions here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Don Luis sips a cognac, staring out the big bay window onto the wide street beyond the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house sits prominent in the middle of a quiet neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco points to the floor plan, explaining to the dozen thugs gathered with their weapons...

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: And here. And here. You must expect the unexpected. She is like mist under a door, like a mouse in the wall. She will never attack straight on. You will not see her, until it is too late. She is that invisible. ON DON LUIS as he sips his cognac. He sees a big red truc approaching in the distance up the road. As he watches, squinting, curious, the truck does an abrupt U turn. Marc drones on in the background... 106.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: We would prefer she be taken alive. But with a bitch like this, if you get a kill shot you take it. ...Don Luis watches, as a woman gets out of the truck. He cannot make out who it is, what with the fog and his vision...

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Marco? He sees the woman open the rear door of the truck, and pull something out. He takes his glasses out of his pocke puts them on. Just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Marco turns.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO DON LUIS AND THE THUGS
dialogues.text: Seeing the rocket heading right for the salon. They all  leap out of the way, just as the rocket comes crashing through the bay window. And blows the salon to smithereen Cat reenters the truck, drives off fast. As the debris falls, and the dust and smoke rises, Marco helps Don Luis up. He is a little stunned. Through the gaping hole where the bay window was, they see the red truck driving off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You four! Get the armored Mercedes! We have to get Don Luis out of here! The four run off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Don Luis! This way! Everyone to their positions! As they all run out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four thugs run into the garage, where there are sever cars. And a big armored van.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: OK! Everyone in! But just as they open the doors to the big Mercedes... 107.

dialogues.speaker: WALL OF THE GARAGE
dialogues.text: Cat leaps out of the truck, and before the four startled thugs know what has hit them, she puts three of them down with shots to the heart. The fourth runs out the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourth thug runs for all he is worth, bleeding from his forehead, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Calmly exiting the garage, she removes a set of throwing knives from a belt around her waist, taking a long minute to gauge the distance. When he has almost reached the  safety of the house...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE THUG
dialogues.text: He drops like dead lead, the two knives embedded in his back.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO WITH DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Inside the house, seeing Cat through a window.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Looking back at him. Pointing a finger at him. Before she disappears in to the drifting mists.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Don Luis! You hide here. He opens a secret door in the wall, revealing a small spa Barely big enough for a man.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Wait for my call. Either she is dead, or we have her far enough away so you can make it to the garage. Take the van. The armor is so thick nothing short of an atomic bomb can penetrate it.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Marco. Thank you. 108.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (TOUCHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first time you ever said that.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Said what?

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get used to it. Don Luis shuts the door. Off the door slamming... Another door opens, but this one is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the side of the mansion, and leads into the foundation Cat crawls in and pulls the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco and the men are walking through the mansion, guns a the ready, when they come to a long stretch of hallway. Marco signals them to stop. He listens carefully. Signals for one of the men to move down the hall. As Marco and the other men wait, the first thug makes his way down the hall, looking left and right, opening doors.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE FLOOR FROM THE CAMERA'S POV
dialogues.text: As the man walks along above, the floor creaks, dust drop down in a fine cloud. As the man progresses, and the dust gets closer and closer...

dialogues.speaker: THE THUG ABOVE
dialogues.text: Turns to Marco to signal everything is OK. Just as he signals he is riddled from below with dozens of bullets. The man dances like a puppet on a string, before falling to the floor, dead. Marco takes a grenade out, flings it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Down! Marco and the thugs dive for cover.

dialogues.speaker: BAARROOM
dialogues.text: The grenade blows a big hole in the floor. As soon as the smoke and the debris stop falling...

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Go! 109. The thugs hesitate. Marco points his gun at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Hesitant, the thugs approach the hole. Pointing their weapons, they unload a barrage of bullets. Then stop. Nothing moves. One of them peers over the side.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: A single shot pieces his eye.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Outside! The thugs and Marco run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs set up two big ass 50 caliber machine guns at the two openings in the foundation.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Kill her! The thugs manning the guns let loose, blasting away. Smok and flashes from the muzzles mingle with the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis hears the firing, which thunders through his closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs fire until their ammo is spent. As the sound dies away, silence reigns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis hears the silence. He speed dials on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking. He motions for one of his men to look into the dark hope. Hesitant the man peeks around the side. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got her. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis lets out a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Did you see the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco urges his man to look deeper, expose himself more, to look in the hole. Marco watches as the man does so, very cautiously. Still no movement. He moves full body into the opening to peer in.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Is blown back by three fast shots.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Marco??

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are! And then he starts screaming into the hole, careful to stand just off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You know what bitch? I loved killing your father. He was a coward! And you know what else? I screwed your mother behind your father's back! We all did! She couldn't get enough of it! The whore! I killed her! I killed him! You want to avenge them? The whore and the coward? That's what you come from! Come out! I'm here! Come get the bullet with your name on it, Bitch! Silence. And then, a whistle from above. Marco looks up  to see Cat, standing on a second floor balcony with two pistols.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Kill her! Marco starts to fire, his men raise their guns. Too late. In the blink of an eye, with bullets flying wildly all around her, Cat blows five of the seven thugs surrounding Marco away. Marco and the remaining two thugs run toward the guest house. Out of the range of her guns. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis is panicking. Yelling into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Marco! Marco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco and the two thugs run into the small house.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: You two here! That door opens... He points to the door they just came through.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: ...kill anything that comes through. Marco runs into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco runs to the curtained windows, rips the curtains back, hoping to escape. And finds that the windows have metal hurricane shutters on them. With locks. Marco pulls out a set of keys, frantically tries fitting the keys to the locks. None of them work.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Shit! He runs for the door again. Just as he has his hand on the knob, two shots ring out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Giorgio? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonino? No answer. He checks his gun, realizes he is out of ammo. He knows his time has come. He drops is gun, backs away from the door. Backs right up to the bed, and sits down. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Marco! What the hell's going on???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco just stares at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Hold on. 112. There is a small sound outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: I will hold here! Run! Run! The door shatters as Cat kicks her way in. Marco pulls his trigger. Click! Click! Click! Marco is frozen. Just stares at Cat. Waiting for what is going to come.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: Do it! Do it you bitch! Isn't this the moment you've been waiting for? Yes, it is. She empties her gun into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripped by fear, Don Luis runs for all he is worth across the fog shrouded garden until he reaches the garage. He yanks open the door, runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis runs around Pepe's red truck and the crumbled Mercedes, jumps in the armored van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis fumbles with the keys, grinds the ignition in hi desperation. The engine turns over. Don Luis slams the transmission into gear, but bangs into the crumbled Merce blocking his way. He slams the gearshift into reverse, bashes into the wall behind him, and then jerks the gear shift into drive, ramming the Mercedes with a little more room. Back and forth back and forth, Don Luis rams at the Mercedes until he has made enough room to turn the van, bang past the Mercedes, and smash his way out of the gara

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van comes roaring out of the garage, tearing up the gardens, jumping on the driveway and speeding off to the main road. Cat comes running from the opposite direction, two guns blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As bullets ping off the van, Don Luis regains some of his confidence. A small smile breaks across his face as he looks in his rear view mirror and sees Cat running and firing, losing ground. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat reaches the end of the driveway, fires her last shots runs out of bullets. Stands watching the van head off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis watches her run out of ammo, standing in the roa receding.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING MADLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beat you bitch! You can't kill me! I am unkillable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat stands in the road, watching the van. She takes out Marco's cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Cat scrolls the phone book. She highlights VAN. Presses SEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Luis is at a red light, so pleased with himself. Humming a tune. When the van phone rings. Surprised, he looks at the call coming in. MARCO. He presses the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: Marco?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: It's Cataleya.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: I don't understand you. You should have been dead a long time ago. You got lucky. You escaped. You were given a second chance at a life. Why did you not take it? Why did you involve yourself with this insanity?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: For something you can never understand. The love I had for my parents. And you killed that.

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS
dialogues.text: And because of that, you have ruined your whole life to try to kill me? You stupid bitch. Don't you get it? Someone like me? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DON LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I cannot be killed. I do the killing. Not the other way around. And now it is your turn to be hunted. You will never find me. But as day follows night, believe me, I will find you. And I will kill you. And you know why? Because I will never be where you can kill me. I will never be where you want me to be.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Actually Don Luis...you are exactly  where I want you to be. Don Luis doesn't get it. And then he hears a low growling behind him. He turns a little, sees sitting there in the dark recesses of the van, two enormous dogs. Pepe's dogs. His eyes register confusion, then apprehension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat hears the growl over the phone. A small smile breaks across her face. And then se speaks into the phone one last time. One word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the sounds of the dogs tearing Don Luis to pieces an his horrible screams, the van shakes as if it were caught in an earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat's shoulders sag, relax. Her face is peaceful as it has never been before. She looks at Marco's phone. Thinking. ROSS V.O. I want you to think hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sits opposite Ross.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Was there anything else?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I already told you everything. She would come over, we'd have amazing sex, and she would leave. It's really late, and I'm really tired, if you're not going to arrest me... 115.

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: We don't really have anything to charge you with.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Then can I go?

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Just a few more questions.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Can I have a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: ROSS
dialogues.text: Sure. Ross gets up and leaves the room. Danny is feeling really shitty. He takes his phone out of his pocket, looks at Cat's picture. And then it rings.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hello? INTERCUT BETWEEN... CAT V.O. Hello Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen...I...uh...I'm so sorry. I didn't mean...are you OK? CAT V.O. I'm fine. She says it without the slightest bit of sarcasm. CAT V.O. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: FBI headquarters. I didn't tell them anything...besides... CAT V.O. That I would come over and we would have amazing sex. Your phone is tapped, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I know. CAT V.O. You have forty seconds before they pick up on this. Gives you the time for three questions.  116.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: OK...What's your real name? CAT V.O. ...Cataleya. Danny looks at the orchid on Ross's desk. Sees the name tag. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Like the flower. Now Cat smiles. How did he know that? CAT V.O. Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Will I ever see you again?

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: I know where to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross is drawing coffee.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1
dialogues.text: Ross. We're picking something up off that kid's phone. Ross drops the coffee, hurries back to the office.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: If there is ever a chance. I want you to know...I could love you. If you let me. CAT V.O. Last question.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: ...I love you. Cat holds on that one for a moment...then the beeping of phone connection cut...Danny closes his eyes. Ross bursts into the office. Grabs the phone from his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cataleya? Cataleya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, in jeans, t-shirt, a baseball cap with her pony tail sticking out the back, exits a phone booth, She boards a waiting bus. The doors close. The bus drives off down an endless road. 117.
